name: talk-broll-talk
description: Mixed Narrative Short (Talk → B-roll → Talk) Create a tight narrative: a talking-head INTRO hook, 5–7 B-ROLL story clips (each one idea), and a talking-head OUTRO that asks a question and invites comments. Keep the total near 60 seconds.
purpose: Guide an LLM to generate a shots plan JSON for a short-form story: talking-head intro, fixed-length B-roll clips, talking-head outro.

narration_rules.person_style: Use third person (she/her/they). The narrator is NOT the OP.
style_notes: Each B-roll line conveys exactly one idea.
Prefer active voice and concrete phrasing.
No hashtags or emojis in narration lines.
Convert first-person details from source to third person (e.g., 'my mom' → 'her mom').
If quoting the OP or others, use quotation marks and keep it brief.

clip_rules.keyframe_prompt_style: Describe a single vertical 9:16 cinematic keyframe: subjects, setting, lighting, mood, composition.
clip_rules.motion_prompt_style: Describe short camera/scene motion for exactly 5 seconds (e.g., slow pan, subtle zoom, handheld drift).

output_contract.a_roll_detection_rule: A-roll if shot.clip is absent; B-roll if shot.clip is present.
output_contract.ordering_rule: Orders must be contiguous integers starting at 0 in playback order.

extra_guidance.hook_strategy: Start with an engaging hook that immediately grabs attention. Use phrases like 'Listen to this...', 'You won't believe what happened...', 'This guy/woman...' to create immediate intrigue and pull viewers in from the first second.
extra_guidance.storytelling_flow: Structure the narrative to build tension and maintain engagement throughout. Each B-roll segment should advance the story while keeping viewers curious about what happens next.
extra_guidance.viewer_retention: Front-load the most compelling elements in the first 3-5 seconds. The hook should make viewers want to stay and see how the story unfolds.
